meanings.definition: A person or thing that reifies.
meanings.sent1: The artist was a talented reifier, bringing abstract ideas to life through their work.
meanings.sent2: The reifier of the sculpture captured the essence of human emotion in the stone.
meanings.sent3: The reifier of dreams turned imagination into reality with a touch of magic.
meanings.sent4: She was a reifier of memories, turning fleeting moments into everlasting treasures.
meanings.sent5: The reifier of thoughts sculpted ideas into tangible forms for all to see.

meanings.definition: To regard or treat (an abstraction) as if it had concrete or material existence.
meanings.sent1: He tends to reifier his fears, making them seem more real than they are.
meanings.sent2: She would often reifier her dreams, believing they held clues to her future.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully reifiered their imaginary friend, setting a place for them at the table.
meanings.sent4: The artist reifiered the wind, painting it as colorful ribbons dancing in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The scientist reifiered time, viewing it as a tangible force that could be manipulated.
